page.title: 06MORE ABOUT COMBE
page.content: Most of the working people from Combe work in Oxford, Woodstock and Kidlington. Combe is very popular with retired people which accounts for the large number of pensioners in the village. In October there is a feast at Combe. They have 2 fair rides and a lot of sideshows. There is a recently built housing estate in the north end of the village called Knotoaks. All the houses in Knotoaks have a tiled roof and three chimnies, most have stone walls but some are built of brick. There are 50 houses in Knotoaks and they are 3 to 4 years old. Local decisions are made by Combe Parish Council and West Oxfordshire District Council
